data.question: What is the parasitic energy of IISERP-MOF2 for postcombustion CO2 capture?
How does the CO2/N2 selectivity of IISERP-MOF2 compare to Mg-MOF-74 and SIFSIX-3-Zn?
data.answer: IISERP-MOF2 has a CO2/N2 selectivity of 1853, which is higher than both Mg-MOF-74 (232) and SIFSIX-3-Zn (629).

data.question: Is the CO2 adsorption capacity of IISERP-MOF2 higher under dry or humid conditions?
data.answer: The CO2 adsorption capacity of IISERP-MOF2 is slightly higher under dry conditions compared to humid conditions.

data.question: Does IISERP-MOF2 retain its crystallinity after exposure to humid CO2?
data.answer: Yes, IISERP-MOF2 retains its crystallinity after exposure to humid CO2.

data.question: What is the heat of adsorption (HOA) for CO2 in IISERP-MOF2?
Can IISERP-MOF2 be synthesized on a large scale while retaining its gas sorption characteristics?
data.answer: Yes, IISERP-MOF2 can be synthesized on a large scale with comparable crystallinity and similar gas sorption characteristics.

data.question: What is the CO2 diffusion coefficient in IISERP-MOF2?
Does IISERP-MOF2 exhibit hydrolytic stability?
data.answer: Yes, IISERP-MOF2 exhibits exceptional hydrolytic stability.

data.question: What is the working capacity of IISERP-MOF2 for CO2 capture?
Does the CO2 adsorption capacity of IISERP-MOF2 decrease significantly after 6 months of exposure to the atmosphere?
data.answer: No, IISERP-MOF2 retains complete porosity even after 6 months of exposure to the atmosphere.

data.question: What is the CO2 uptake capacity of IISERP-MOF2 under dynamic conditions?
Is the CO2 adsorption isotherm of IISERP-MOF2 unchanged following steam treatment?
data.answer: Yes, the CO2 adsorption isotherm of IISERP-MOF2 is unchanged following steam treatment.

data.question: What is the CO2/N2 selectivity of IISERP-MOF2 at 1 bar and 313 K?
Does IISERP-MOF2 have a higher CO2/N2 selectivity than SIFSIX-3-Cu?
data.answer: False, SIFSIX-3-Cu has a higher CO2/N2 selectivity (5463) than IISERP-MOF2.

data.question: What is the effect of including the energy required to place the system under vacuum on the total parasitic energy of IISERP-MOF2?
data.answer: Including the energy required to place the system under vacuum increases the difference in the parasitic energy to the next closest material from 39 to 86 kJ/kg CO2.

data.question: Does IISERP-MOF2 lose more than 10% of its CO2 adsorption capacity under humid conditions?
data.answer: False, IISERP-MOF2 only loses about 7% of its maximum CO2 capacity under humid conditions.

data.question: What is the CO2 adsorption capacity of IISERP-MOF2 at 303 K and 0.15 bar?
Can IISERP-MOF2 withstand carbonic acid without losing its CO2 adsorption capacity?
data.answer: Yes, the CO2 adsorption isotherm of IISERP-MOF2 remains unchanged following exposure to a flow of humid CO2 for 24 h.

data.question: What is the average CO2 self-diffusion coefficient of IISERP-MOF2?
Does IISERP-MOF2 maintain its performance after repeated adsorption cycles?
data.answer: Yes, IISERP-MOF2 retains most of its performance after repeated adsorption cycles.
